description:
Lithium batteries give this power station plenty of juice, without making it too heavy. For adventure vans and off-grid basecamps, you can watch Netflix on rainy days, and charge all your gadgets. There are lots of port options for charging from your car's power point, wall or USB.

  • Charge time: 2 hours from USB PD, 4 hours from wall charger, 5–10 hours from the Boulder 50 solar panel
  • Plug battery into a power source during storage, or fully-charge every 3-6 months
  • Peak capacity is 187Wh (14.4V, 13Ah) and lasts through hundreds of cycles
  • Charging and low-battery protection
  • AC inverter “wall plug” - accepts grounded and ungrounded plugs (output, modified sine wave): 120VAC, 60hZ, 1A (120W continuous, 200W surge)
  • 2 USB ports (regulated output): 5V, up to 2.4A (12W max)
  • USB C port (regulated output): 5¬–12V, up top 3A (18W max)
  • USB PD (regulated input and output): 5–20V, up to 3A (60W max)
  • 12V car port (regulated output): 12V, up to 10A (120W max)
  • 6mm port (regulated output): 12V, up to 10A (120W max)
  • Charging port (regulated input, 8mm): 13-22V, up to 7A (100W max)
  • LCD power status display tells you how much power you are getting and using, as well as battery charge capacity
  • Operating temp is 0-40°C
name: Goal Zero Lithium Yeti 200X Portable Power Station
